reviews.text: After my first visit in August to the Hotel Paisano, I will be visiting this hotel many times in the future for pleasure.....I loved loved loved the funky, cool, vibe. Stay up late (the desk actually closes down, so you have the lobby to yourself) and sit in an overstuffed leather chair in the lobby and you can feel the ghosts of lives past wandering around.....
reviews.title: Paisano is Beyond Cool and Funky!!!
Great old historic hotel, good food
reviews.text: Rooms are functional, comfortable, but not a Hilton or Hampton even....but again, dig the vibe!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And my favorite part of the visit was sitting in the outside courtyard dining at Jetts Grill....absolutely wonderful food....and I dont mean "for Marfa", but Jetts could compete with the finer establishments in Dallas or Austin.... Pistachio-crusted sirloin (a glorified CFS) and jalapeno gravy, with mashers, grilled jalapeno and peas in the shell.....a wonderful meal.
reviews.title: Hotel Paisano Very Cool place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Marfa has become an artsy designation...and worthy of the drive. Spend a few days, turn off the cell phone, walk around and look at stuff.....and just dig the vibe....man..... :-)
reviews.title: Love Marfa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are small but that is what they had in 1930. Very cool hotel. Stayed in the James Dean room, small and bathroom was tiny. I guess james was more famous after he died. quite, beds are good, food is very good. Best place in marfa.
reviews.title: Exactly what we needed!
Very nice hotel
reviews.text: Hotel Paisano was a very pleasant experience with a very nice first floor room and a small patio with a fireplace. We sat out by the fire drinking a nice bottle of wine then ventured into the bar for a little socialization. Everyone was nice and efficient. Checking in and check out was easy and quick. It is centrally located and you can walk to everything. The bathroom was small but very adequate for such an old historic hotel. We had a great stay.

Besides being literally the "only place to stay in Marfa," you won't be disappointed. The rooms are small, but have been updated. No phone in room, but you won't need it. After all, you're in Marfa. The hotel is brimming with ambiance as this 1930's hotel gives you the sense your '29 Ford is parked outside. Charm doesn't fully describe the sense of history you get when you walk into their lobby. Many a great actor and artist have passed through their doors. One can sit outside in the fountain courtyard and enjoy conversation with folks from around the world. The restaurant will complete any evening with its full assortment of meals. Beds are some of the more comfortable I've slept in when it comes to motels. Most rooms have patios with fireplaces (downstairs) or verandas (upstairs). The staff will go out of their way to make your stay comfortable. Complimentary fruit always available and coffee and tea all day. You really won't be disappointed
reviews.title: Only place to stay in Marfa!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel on a trip to big Bend National Park. Great old hotel. Lots of character. We stayed in the "Rock Hudson Suite" where the star stayed during the filming of the movie Giant. It had a large living room with a fireplace, a kitchen, a dining table, a wet bar, an extra seating area in the bedroom and a very large balcony. The room was nice but not really fancy.
reviews.title: Classic Old Hotel

reviews.text: We were there on a Wednesday night and the place was packed. Cars from California, New York, Tennessee and Arizona were parked in front of the hotel. The patio was full of people having a drink and socializing with one another.
reviews.title: Old Classic Hotel - Giant was filed here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a ton of only 2100 people, Marfa has a number of good restaurants. One of the best is in the hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is where all the stars for the fifties classic stayed. They even have a room set aside honoring the movie and their guests. The staff was friendly and while the hotel is old it retains it's dignity and charm like an old dowager. We stayed in a large suite with a tiny bathroom. The indoor pool was neat. Stay away from the restaurant though :(.
reviews.title: Hotel of the Giants

reviews.text: This hotel was wonderful. It was a great location downtown.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very 1930's architecture, inside and out. I had a suite that overlooked the courtyard, which was wonderful. A nice patio to sit out on, great beds in a beautiful bedroom, a nice little kitchen... The TV was small, but I did not mind that at all.
reviews.title: Infinite West Texas Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a restaurant down there, I had a salad down there and it was not the most amazing one I've ever had but it was good. Alittle pricey for the food, though. Hotel is abit expensive too, but I believe it's worth it.
reviews.title: Charming and historic

reviews.text: Would recommend to anybody staying in Marfa.
reviews.title: Nice but pricey for what you get
Overpriced and uncomfortable
reviews.text: It's an interesting and historical place, but just plain overpriced for what it is. It is considerably more than the $79-$89 per night shown on Trip Advisor. Actually goes from about $120 a $200. The room was very small (ok), but the bath was rediculous and the shower water ended up all over the floor. The bed was uncomfortable, and the hotel noisy early in the morning.
On the positive side, it had a decent view with a nice outside seating area. And the staff was very pleasant. But I think I would try another place next time.
reviews.title: Great experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel exceeded our expectations. Not only was it charming but the staff was great. Just moving from Austin I was thinking the Thunderbird would be a great choice (and seems nice enough) but glad we chose El Paisano. From Carlos in the bar to both men at the front desk, we were impressed. In fact all staff members we encountered went above and beyond. Not only did we blow a fuse in our room, twice, but we were with a large group that had a lot of requests. Cute gift shops and the "Giant" room was a bonus! We stayed in one of the Mezzanine suites, it was roomy and extremely clean.
reviews.title: A bit of cinematic history....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: is awaiting you here, where the cast of "Giant" stayed in 1955. If you really want to splurge, ask for the Rock Hudson Suite. The second story rooms (no elevator available) are spacious and well appointed. On the negative side, water pressure leaves a bit to be desired and there is no breakfast available close by most days. Charming patio to relax with an adult beverage before or after dinner.
reviews.title: Impressive hotel in little Marfa

reviews.text: Marfa is such a wonder of a place... delicious dining, funky art, great vistas... and the marvelous Hotel Paisano. Such history with the making of "Giant", with beautiful architecture, excellent service, and a wonderful restaurant. We went for a special birthday celebration and will definitely recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Interesting Historic Hotel
